section.title: Creating the Component with a Page Tag
section.para: To create the simplest variant of the component on a page use the following syntax:
section.programlisting: <a4j:commandLink value="Follow this link" reRender="some ID" action="#{bean.action}" />
section.para: The example above creates a link on a page clicking on which causes an Ajax form submit on the server, "action" method performance, and rendering the component with "someData" ID after response comes back.

section.title: Creating the Component Dynamically Using Java
Details of Usage
section.para: The <a4j:commandLink> component is used in the same way as JSF <h:commandLink>. The difference is that in case of <a4j:commandLink> the components to be updated should be specified.
The example above generates the following HTML code:
section.programlisting: Follow this link
section.para: If you click on the generated anchor the utility method A4J.AJAX.Submit() will be fired. It's not necessary to add nested <a4j:support> as the <a4j:commandLink> has an Ajax support already built-in.

note.title: Note:
note.para: Common JSF navigation could be performed after Ajax submit and partial rendering, but Navigation Case must be defined as <redirect/> in order to avoid problems with some browsers.

section.para: As any Core Ajax component that sends Ajax requests and processes server responses the <a4j:commandLink> has all attributes that provide the required behavior of requests (delay, limitation of submit area and rendering, etc.)
Information about the "process" attribute usage you can find "Decide what to process" guide section.
